intro.description: Use the New Connections window to create, edit, and manage remote connection settings to enable on-device debugging and the installation of remote agents.

item.title: Open the New Connections window
item.description: Use the New Connections window to create, edit, and manage remote connection settings to enable on-device debugging and the installation of remote agents.

subitem.label: Click Help > On-Device Connections to open the New Connection window.

item.title: Define the remote connection
item.description: Use the Edit connection name and type page to define basic remote connection settings.

subitem.label: Enter a name for this connection
Select the connection type required to connect to the remote device.

item.title: Select serial port and device OS
item.description: In the Connection settings page specify the connection settings, the device OS, and verify the presence of a remote agent.

subitem.label: Select the serial port from the available list. A named COM port (COM4 - BthModem0) indicates an active port.
Select the OS used by the device from the dropdown list.

item.title: Verify connection and presence of remote agent
item.description: Select service to test and click Initiate service testing

subitem.label: Select a service in the Select the service to test list.
Click Initiate service test to test the connection.
Examine Status box for results. Failures indicate that the COM port is not open. Not responding indicates that no service is running on the device.
Click Finish to create the connection setting and have it appear in the Remote Connections view.

item.title: Verify and monitor connections
item.description: Verify and monitor connections using the Remote Connections view.
